intro: Impatiens mayombensis, commonly known as the Mayombensis Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
